trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> objects.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> class represents the aggregation of all the items in a smart tag panel.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> class contains zero or more <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects.
Each of these lists contains zero or more objects that represent the actual items in the panel and are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem> class.

The following table shows the two techniques for supplying a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> to populate the panel with items for components, including custom controls.
Technique
Description
Pull model

The designer for the component class, which is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner> class, supplies this collection through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property.
The designer infrastructure reads this property when it must display the panel.
Push model

A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> or <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> is supplied as a parameter in a call to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionService.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionService> associated with the component.
The designer infrastructure constructs a panel by creating a smart tag panel, whose constructor takes two parameters of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection>.
The collections of lists, which contain the pulled and pushed items, are merged into one panel.

Because it derives from the <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase?displayProperty=fullName> class, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> uses an internal <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> to store its collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> class with default settings.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor creates an empty collection, containing zero <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> class with the specified panel items.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor creates a collection that contains the supplied <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects.
The array of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> objects to populate the collection.
value is `null`.
Adds the supplied <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to the current collection.
The new element is added to the end of the internal list.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to add.
The position into which the new element is inserted into the collection's internal list.
Adds the elements of the supplied <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> array to the end of the current collection.
The new elements are added to the end of the internal list.

After validating the `value` parameter, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection.AddRange%2A> method makes a series of calls to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection.Add%2A> method to individually add each element.
The array of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> objects to add.
value is `null`.
Adds the elements of the supplied <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> to the end of the current collection.
The new elements are added to the end of the internal list.

After validating the `value` parameter, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection.AddRange%2A>method makes a series of calls to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection.Add%2A> method to individually add each element.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> to add.
value is `null`.
Indicates whether the collection contains a specific value.
A match is determined by value, not identity, comparison.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to search for.
`true` if the collection contains the specified value; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the elements of the current collection into the supplied array, starting at the specified array index.
If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection.CopyTo%2A> method throws an exception while copying, the state of the destination array is undefined.
For example, if an <xref:System.ArgumentException> or <xref:System.InvalidCastException> occurs, the destination array may be left in a partially filled state.
The one-dimensional array of type <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than 0.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the current collection is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
A problem occurred casting the elements of the current collection to the type of the destination array, perhaps as the result of a failed downcast.
Determines the index of a specific item in the collection.

Internally, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> class uses a <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> to contain its collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The index of value if found in the internal list; otherwise, -1.
Inserts the supplied <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> into the collection at the specified position.
If the `index` parameter is equal to the value of the <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A> property, the new element is added to the end of the collection.

Internally, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> class uses a <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> to contain its collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects.
Because lists maintain contiguous elements, the elements that follow the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element.
This rearrangement changes the index of the elements after the insertion point.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to insert into the collection.
index is less than 0 or greater than the count of elements in the current collection.
Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
Setting an element to `null` causes a design-time exception to be thrown when the smart tag panel is displayed.
The zero-based index of the element.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> at the specified index.
Performs additional custom processes when clearing the contents of the <xref href="System.Collections.CollectionBase"></xref> instance.
Performs additional custom processes before inserting a new element into the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> instance.
The zero-based index at which to insert value.
The new value of the element at index.
Performs additional custom processes when removing an element from the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> instance.
The zero-based index at which value can be found.
The value of the element to remove from index.
Performs additional custom processes before setting a value in the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> instance.
The zero-based index at which oldValue can be found.
The value to replace with newValue.
The new value of the element at index.
Performs additional custom processes when validating a value.
The object to validate.
Removes the first occurrence of a specific <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> from the collection.

Internally, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> class uses a <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> to contain its collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects.
Since lists maintain contiguous elements, the elements that follow the removal point move up to occupy the vacated spot.
This rearrangement changes the index of the elements after the removal point.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList"></xref> to remove from the current collection.
